      • getNumberToReturn

        public int getNumberToReturn()
        Gets the limit of the number of documents in the first OP_REPLY response to the query. A value of zero tells the server to use the default size. A negative value tells the server to return no more than that number and immediately close the cursor. Otherwise, the server will return no more than that number and return a cursorId to allow the rest of the documents to be fetched, if it turns out there are more documents.

        The value returned by this method is based on the limit and the batch size, both of which can be positive, negative, or zero.

        Returns:
        the value for numberToReturn in the OP_QUERY wire protocol message.

        MongoDB Doc Links
        • OP_QUERY
